events.body:
ACK everything except copyright bumps.

This PR's review time will be long...
@paveljanik You can apply the bump script in `contrib/` locally and then diff with my result to see the "actual" diff.

The script is not portable... On OS X:

```
date: illegal time format
usage: date [-jnu] [-d dst] [-r seconds] [-t west] [-v[+|-]val[ymwdHMS]] ... 
            [-f fmt date | [[[mm]dd]HH]MM[[cc]yy][.ss]] [+format]
```

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/indirectmap.h doesn't contain copyright header at all.

> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/indirectmap.h doesn't contain copyright header at all.

Somone would need to ask the author where it came from. Only they can chose the copyright...

> @paveljanik The script is not portable...

I changed something. It may or may not work now.

> ACK everything except copyright bumps.

Agree with @paveljanik

@paveljanik

Can you try the bump script again on osx and ack the diff?
@MarcoFalke Sure, I will try to do it this week.

ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8286/commits/fade7e93827646e5f393af8dcbc7e1e5a9717bc9

Fixed script `contrib/devtools/fix-copyright-headers.py` now works even on OS X. Thanks!

events.message: Link to developer notes in README.md

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -31,7 +31,8 @@ The `master` branch is regularly built and tested, but is not guaranteed to be
 completely stable. [Tags](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tags) are created
 regularly to indicate new official, stable release versions of Bitcoin Core.
 
-The contribution workflow is described in [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md).
+The contribution workflow is described in [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md)
+and useful hints for developers can be found in [doc/developer-notes.md](doc/developer-notes.md)
comments.body: Missing dot at the end of sentence.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -95,26 +95,21 @@
 # running on another host using this option:
 #rpcconnect=127.0.0.1
 
-# Transaction Fee Changes in 0.10.0
-
-# Send transactions as zero-fee transactions if possible (default: 0)
-#sendfreetransactions=0
-
 # Create transactions that have enough fees (or priority) so they are likely to begin confirmation within n blocks (default: 1).
 # This setting is over-ridden by the -paytxfee option.
 #txconfirmtarget=n
 
+# Pay an optional transaction fee every time you send bitcoins.  Transactions with fees
+# are more likely than free transactions to be included in generated blocks, so may
+# be validated sooner.
+#paytxfee=0.00
comments.body:
The unit (BTC/kB) of `paytxfee` should be specified here, as it is in `bitcoind -?`.
I also would completely remove the second sentence.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -95,26 +95,21 @@
 # running on another host using this option:
 #rpcconnect=127.0.0.1
 
-# Transaction Fee Changes in 0.10.0
-
-# Send transactions as zero-fee transactions if possible (default: 0)
-#sendfreetransactions=0
-
 # Create transactions that have enough fees (or priority) so they are likely to begin confirmation within n blocks (default: 1).
 # This setting is over-ridden by the -paytxfee option.
 #txconfirmtarget=n
 
+# Pay an optional transaction fee every time you send bitcoins.  Transactions with fees
+# are more likely than free transactions to be included in generated blocks, so may
+# be validated sooner.
+#paytxfee=0.00
comments.body:
Oh right. I was just moving the sentence.

A general rewrite should be preferred.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -94,12 +94,12 @@
 if ENABLE_ZMQ:
     try:
         import zmq
-    except ImportError as e:
-        print("WARNING: \"import zmq\" failed. Set ENABLE_ZMQ=0 or " \
-            "to run zmq tests, see dependency info in /qa/README.md.")
-        ENABLE_ZMQ=0
+    except ImportError:
+        print("ERROR: \"import zmq\" failed. Set ENABLE_ZMQ=0 or "
+              "to run zmq tests, see dependency info in /qa/README.md.")
+        # ENABLE_ZMQ=0

@@ -94,12 +94,12 @@
 if ENABLE_ZMQ:
     try:
         import zmq
-    except ImportError as e:
-        print("WARNING: \"import zmq\" failed. Set ENABLE_ZMQ=0 or " \
-            "to run zmq tests, see dependency info in /qa/README.md.")
-        ENABLE_ZMQ=0
+    except ImportError:
+        print("ERROR: \"import zmq\" failed. Set ENABLE_ZMQ=0 or "
+              "to run zmq tests, see dependency info in /qa/README.md.")
+        # ENABLE_ZMQ=0
comments.body:
Someone catching this exception and reading this line can just uncomment
it, instead of looking up how to unset zmq...

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -95,26 +95,21 @@
 # running on another host using this option:
 #rpcconnect=127.0.0.1
 
-# Transaction Fee Changes in 0.10.0
+# Wallet options
 
-# Send transactions as zero-fee transactions if possible (default: 0)
-#sendfreetransactions=0
-
-# Create transactions that have enough fees (or priority) so they are likely to begin confirmation within n blocks (default: 1).
+# Create transactions that have enough fees so they are likely to begin confirmation within n blocks.
 # This setting is over-ridden by the -paytxfee option.
 #txconfirmtarget=n
 
+# Pay a transaction fee every time you send bitcoins.
+#paytxfee=0.000x
comments.body: Maybe mention that this is per KB?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@
 #!/usr/bin/env python3
-# Copyright (c) 2015 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Copyright (c) 2015-2016 The Bitcoin Core developers
comments.body:
~~Has this been changed in 2016?~~
nm: I think so.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -95,26 +95,21 @@
 # running on another host using this option:
 #rpcconnect=127.0.0.1
 
-# Transaction Fee Changes in 0.10.0
+# Wallet options
 
-# Send transactions as zero-fee transactions if possible (default: 0)
-#sendfreetransactions=0
-
-# Create transactions that have enough fees (or priority) so they are likely to begin confirmation within n blocks (default: 1).
+# Create transactions that have enough fees so they are likely to begin confirmation within n blocks.
 # This setting is over-ridden by the -paytxfee option.
 #txconfirmtarget=n
 
+# Pay a transaction fee every time you send bitcoins.
+#paytxfee=0.000x
comments.body: All fees exposed via the user interface are BTC per kB (or mBTC per Byte). I don't think it adds value to mention it everywhere.
